original_text: I really expected more from Outlook by 2019. The 'focused/other' categories of inbox are somewhat helpful, but they don't make up for the erratic way that Outlook stacks email conversations. Gmail did a much better job of keeping those conversations together. In Outlook, they are all over the place. But the WORST part is that even though I have the app set to give me push notifications, it only does so sporadically, which means I frequently don't see important emails in a timely fashion!

original_text: My original review was 4.7 stars. I have to change it to 1 now. The app ia great - the best mail client out there. But over time, its performance deteriorates. After a few month of use, it becomes so slow that it takes minutes (15 minutes! in some cases) to open an email on the latest hardware. Microsoft tells you to reset your account, which improves performance for a few days. After the few days, the performance is back to the snail pace, and you have to reset the app more and more frequently.

original_text: NEW ICON IS UGLY! Why do Microsoft keep making bad design choices? Calandar notifications don't come up unless the app is  the currently displayed app on your screen. if you put your phone to sleep then the notifications for calendar items don't work. The only things that did work is that you can read emails that are already in your inbox. New emails take too long to sync to the app and you'll have probably read them on a PC by that time. Sending messages with attachments greater than 10Mb is a nightmare.  *Latest update has really screwed it completly. Calander colours no longer work. events are displayed in random colours. The calander widget shows multiple calanders even though I've selected one to be shown. This app is poorly written and terribly implemented. Not usable because unreliable*

original_text: Outlook is a simple email app with a good interface, but is has some underlying flaws that have never been resolved in the years I've used it. If you have an IMAP email account (anything besides Exchange and Gmail) then it can take over a minute to search for old emails, and once you tap on the email it will never load. There is no setting to have Outlook download more than a few weeks of email, so there is no way to make the search go faster, and if you're in an area with no reception then you are screwed.

original_text: I would expect much better performance from one of the top software developers in the world.  1. Rules created in Outlook do not carry over to mobile. I continue to receive notifications for emails I have elected to "mark as read" and "move to folder" in Rules.  2. Formatted text in signature does not carry over to mobile. My signature in new emails, and replies is in plain text. Creates the opposite of a seamless transition.  3. Search functionality in mobile is almost entirely pointless. Does not provide any options of where to search, and search does not index all emails, or even all of the emails in the active inbox.  4. Cannot find a way to view other people's calendars. This should be a very obvious feature that is either hidden or non-existant.  Microsoft, PLEASE update this app! I am getting notifications constantly from emails that are supposed to be being marked as read and moved to a separate folder. If I turn notifications off, I don't receive important email notifications or calendar notifications, but if I leave them on, I receive constant emails that I don't need to look at. Desktop to mobile should be a much more seamless transition.

original_text: This app has really screwed the pooch recently. When I reply to an email internally, then separately reply to the same email internally, the Android version of the app include the internal reply too so that the external viewer can see all. The inadequate "fix" is now to include the warning "external sender". It's like the developers don't know how business is conducted.  External email: "We decline payment of your invoice because we are a hostile client"  Forwarded internally "Can you fu*&ing believe this guy?!". External email "We would appreciate prompt payment, though in the style of Trump business style management we understand that you want to renegotiate after the fact". Client sees both internal and external emails. What a moronic backwards step in email "functionality".  Further inconsistencies between handheld app and desktop: new emails are at the bottom, not the top. Why?! WHY!!?? Inconsistency = inefficiency.  I have lost so much functionality in the pocket app that I no longer trust this app. Also, when I mark an email as "unread", every previous email in the thread is marked the same. Wasting my time!!

original_text: The app works decently enough, I have to say that. Mails show up, and you can read them. I like the haptic feedback when I wipe away mails.  But I can't recommend using this as your daily driver, especially for work related mails. And the simple reason for that is that THIS APP WILL KEEP LOSING YOUR CREDENTIALS AND ACCOUNT SETTINGS.  Just when you start wondering why no more mails show up, you open the app just to realize that, yes, you have to enter your imap server address and password again.  Not only does the app not tell you it lost the credentials (a simple push notification would suffice!!) meaning you miss out on potentially days of mails (and I did), but then it's the added hassle of having to find your information again. IT departments will hate you forever.  So again, I don't recommend using the app. I don't dislike it per se. It could be faster, and better at rendering. Mails show up too big, or too small, and zooming will be disabled. But losing my credentials, again and again (my last review, which I wrote five years ago when I got my first android phone said basically the same thing) makes this app to unreliable to be a daily driver. I needs them mails.

original_text: Overall: It's a big improvement over older versions but it's still missing a lot of useful functionality of 3rd party email clients like going to next/previous email after deleting, picture in signature, and most importantly you cannot see more folders like sent, etc in single view together with Inbox.  Updated review after 2 weeks, down to 2 stars. Contacts are synced with the phone but they are "read-only" there is no instructions on how to make them fully editable. You also cannot see the notes associated with the contact because outlook makes them ""This contact is read-only".  It's a really nice, fast, and usable email client, but with problems listed above, I cannot recommend this app anymore.

original_text: **UPDATE - April '19** Another 18 months of 'development' and Public Folders are still not supported.  Hey, Microsoft - Exchange Public Folders are YOUR idea and this is YOUR app for accessing email - why do you continue to keep accesst to Public Folders 'off-limits'?    ------------------------------Original review, Sept '17:  Aagh! Still no access to Public Folders - Business users like me really need this.  It's otherwise clean and easy to use, but lacks the power of the 'Nine' email and calendar app. and the calendar still has none of the beauty of the Sunrise calendar app Microsoft bought and scuppered a year or so ago.  It seems pointless to acquire such a polished app then just kill it without using any of the style and features that made it such an outstanding calendar.  Uninstalled after a week - I'll be sticking with 'Nine'.

If these issues aren't fixed, I'll likely revert to using the native email app on my phone.

original_text: Sick of all sync failures, time outs. Removed my account. Reinstalled Outlook. Multiple times. No good. Here is what finally worked for me: I have a linksys router, logged in and went to: Connectivity>Internet Settings>IPv6>Edit>Uncheck IPv6 - Automatic Enabled [box] ie: It now is NOT enabled. Save the new settings. Let the router reboot if it wants. BOOM! SOLVED (at least for me)!!!
text: sick of all sync failure time out removed my account installed outlook multiple time no good here is what finally worked for me i have a link router logged in and went to conectivityinternet setingsipvedituncheck ipv automatic enabled box ie it now is not enabled save the new setting let a link router reboot if it want boom solved at least for me

original_text: Outlook's determined insistence in updating emails continuosly is a battery draining & Data plan depleting problem. Unless you use a "Mobile Firewall" to block Outlook & manually allow it when needed, it checks & downloads emails continuously "no matter what you do on Outlook or Android settings." It has a big appetite to keep an always active channel with MS servers. Otherwise a smooth & effective app, has become a battery & Data drainer. Gone back to GMail, offers manual check alongside auto.

original_text: The last few updates broke and have not repaired my issues.  I am on Android 7 Droid Turbo 2.  I have an Hotmail account. I do not see my new emails in my inbox. I tried clearing cache, closing app, uninstalling and reinstalling and nothing works (shutting off my phone and restarting does not help).  While Outlook is open I will get a notice new emails have arrived and while I am looking at my inbox, they do not show up.  I found out that if I disable WifI, as soon as 4G takes over (takes a few seconds), the new emails come in.   Later in the day, emails will come in fine while I am on WiFi. Outlook has worked flawlessly for me for the last 3 years but the month or so sucked.  Quick update:  I forgot to mention that when I uninstall and reinstall, or just update it says the inbox needs to download the messages.  I will wait 5- 10 minutes and it would not update.  The inbox is empty.  As soon as I turn off the WiFi, the messages pop right in.  So the issue with my setup is, wifi is unreliable.  VW 4G works fine.
